intro: Asteroschoenus speciosus var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved asteroschoenus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and produces clusters of small, star-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and grass-like plants. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest in horticultural collections.
